titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Unused printed forms from the Virginia Land Office, undated
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia LOI 14
titlepage.author: Claire Radcliffe

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Unused printed forms from the Virginia Land Office, undated

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia. Land Office. Unused printed forms from the Virginia Land Office, undated. Accession Land Office inventory entry no. 14, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Archives Branch, Richmond, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession LOI 14 transferred by the Secretary of the Commonwealth, 1948.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The act which established the previous Land Office next hit passed the General Assembly on 22 June 1779. The register was the head of the Office and was appointed by joint ballot of both houses of the legislature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records contain printed forms for treasury warrants from the state Librarian and treasury warrants and land grants from the secretary of the commonwealth which were never issued. The forms grant permission to the recipient to survey and lay off land.

controlaccess.head: Corporate Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Library of Virginia. Office of the State Librarian.
